member.name: Windows.CryptSIPAddProvider
member.summary: The CryptSIPAddProvider function registers functions that are exported by a given DLL file that implements a Subject Interface Package (SIP).
member.param: A pointer to a structure that specifies the DLL file and function names to register.
member.returns: The return value is TRUE if the function succeeds; FALSE if the function fails. If the function fails, call the function to determine the reason for failure.

member.name: Windows.CryptSIPCreateIndirectData
member.summary: The structure, the digest algorithm, and an encoding attribute. The hash can be used as an indirect reference to the data.
member.param: A pointer to a structure that contains the subject to which the indirect data reference will point.
A pointer to a structure.
A pointer to a structure to receive the catalog item.

returns.para: The return value is TRUE if the function succeeds; otherwise, FALSE.
If this function returns FALSE, additional error information can be obtained by calling the function. GetLastError will return one of the following error codes.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
The file or data format is not correct for the specified subject interface package (SIP) type.
One or more of the parameters are not valid.
There was an error allocating memory.
The specified algorithm is not supported by the SIP.
The subject type is not recognized.

member.name: Windows.CryptSIPGetCaps
member.summary: The CryptSIPGetCaps function retrieves the capabilities of a subject interface package (SIP).
member.param: Pointer to a structure that specifies subject information data to the SIP APIs.
Pointer to a structure that defines the capabilities of an SIP.

member.name: Windows.CryptSIPGetSignedDataMsg
member.summary: The CryptSIPGetSignedDataMsg function retrieves an Authenticode signature from the file.
member.param: A pointer to a structure that contains information about the message subject.

param.name: pdwEncodingType
param.para: The encoding type of the Authenticode signature.
This parameter can be a combination of one or more of the following values.

listheader.description: Value
Meaning
Specifies PKCS #7 message encoding.
Specifies X.509 certificate encoding.

member.param: This parameter is reserved and should be set to zero.
The length, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by the pbSignedDataMsg parameter.

param.name: pbSignedDataMsg
param.para: A pointer to a buffer to receive the returned Authenticode signature.

To determine the size of the buffer needed, set the pbSignedDataMsg parameter to NULL and call the CryptSIPGetSignedDataMsg function. This function will place the required size of the buffer, in bytes, in the value pointed to by pcbSignedDataMsg. For more information, seeRetrieving Data of Unknown Length.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the function returns TRUE.
If the function fails, it returns FALSE. For extended error information, call . Some possible error codes follow.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
The signature specified by the index could not be found.
The specified data or file format of the subject interface package (SIP) is not valid.
The [SIP_SUBJECTINFO](/windows/desktop/api/mssip/ns-mssip-sip_subjectinfo) structure is a null pointer.
The size of the message buffer was insufficient to hold the retrieved data, the pcbSignedDataMsg parameter has been set to indicate the required buffer size.
The specified subject type is not valid.

member.name: Windows.CryptSIPLoad
member.summary: The structure. The exported functions must have been previously registered by calling the function.
member.param: A pointer to a GUID returned by calling the function.
This parameter is reserved and must be set to zero.

A pointer to a structure that contains pointers to SIP provider functions that are specific to the subject type. The caller must initialize this structure to binary zeros, and set the cbSize member to sizeof(SIP_DISPATCH_INFO) before calling the CryptSIPLoad function.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the function returns TRUE.
If the function fails, it returns FALSE. For extended error information, call .

member.name: Windows.CryptSIPRemoveProvider
member.summary: The CryptSIPRemoveProvider function removes registry details of a Subject Interface Package (SIP) DLL file added by a previous call to the function.
member.param: A pointer to the GUID that identifies the SIP DLL to remove.
member.returns: The return value is TRUE if the function succeeds; FALSE if the function fails. If the function fails, call the function to determine the reason for failure.

member.name: Windows.CryptSIPRemoveSignedDataMsg
member.summary: The CryptSIPRemoveSignedDataMsg function removes a specified Authenticode signature.
member.param: A pointer to a structure that contains information about the message subject.
This parameter is reserved and should be set to zero.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the function returns TRUE.
If the function fails, it returns FALSE. For extended error information, call .

member.name: Windows.CryptSIPRetrieveSubjectGuid
member.summary: The CryptSIPRetrieveSubjectGuid function retrieves a GUID based on the header information in a specified file. The GUID is used by the function to load the subject interface package (SIP) implementation for the given file type.
member.param: The name of the file.
A handle to the file to check.
A GUID that identifies the subject.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the function returns TRUE.
If the function fails, it returns FALSE. For extended error information, call .

member.name: Windows.CryptSIPRetrieveSubjectGuidForCatalogFile
member.summary: The CryptSIPRetrieveSubjectGuidForCatalogFile function retrieves the subject GUID associated with the specified file.
member.param: The name of the file. If the hFileIn parameter is set, the value in this parameter is ignored.
A handle to the file to check. This parameter must contain a valid handle if the FileName parameter is NULL.
A globally unique ID that identifies the subject.

returns.para: The return value is TRUE if the function succeeds; otherwise, FALSE.
If this function returns FALSE, additional error information can be obtained by calling the function. GetLastError will return one of the following error codes.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
One or more of the parameters are not valid.

member.name: Windows.CryptSIPVerifyIndirectData
member.summary: The CryptSIPVerifyIndirectData function validates the indirect hashed data against the supplied subject.
member.param: A pointer to a structure that contains information about the message subject.
A pointer to a structure that contains information about the hashed subject information.

returns.para: The return value is TRUE if the function succeeds; otherwise, FALSE.
If this function returns FALSE, additional error information can be obtained by calling the function. GetLastError will return one of the following error codes.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
One or more of the parameters are not valid.
The subject type is an unknown type.
